newsitem.title: USA: U.S. House strikes $91 mln FDA user fees from bill.
newsitem.headline: U.S. House strikes $91 mln FDA user fees from bill.

text.p: The U.S. House of Representatives on Thursday removed a mandate from a fiscal 1998 appropriations bill that would have directed to the Food and Drug Adminstration to collect $91 million in user fees from pharmaceutical companies.

Rep. Richard Burr, a North Carolina Republican, asked for a parliamentary ruling that the mandate was out of order on the funding bill. The presiding officer of the House agreed and ordered the seven lines of instructions to be struck from the bill.
Neither Burr or a spokesman for him was immediately available to explain his challenge of the user fees, paid by pharmacuetical companies to underwrite FDA reviews of drugs.
Earlier in the day, the Senate passed an appropriations bill that included the $91 million in user fees, so the issue may be addressed when the two chambers write a final version of the bill.
